intro: Diplotaxis berthautii, commonly known as the African star-of-Bethlehem, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Brassicaceae family, which includes mustard and cress plants. The plant is characterized by its basal rosette of narrow, blue-green leaves and produces small, white or pale yellow flowers arranged in a cluster. It is drought-tolerant and thrives in well-drained soils, making it suitable for rock gardens and arid landscapes. The plant is also known for its medicinal properties and has been used in traditional herbal remedies.
